title: Pittenweem to Anstruther Coastal Path Walking Route

nearby.description: St Andrews to Anstruther Coastal Walk
Lower Largo to Shell Bay and Elie Coastal Walk

images.title: Jim Bain / Pittenweem
images.caption: Pittenweem. Taken from the outer harbour wall. The coastline around here is a conservation area and with fine buildings like these you can see why.

images.title: Sandy Gemmill / Pittenweem High Street
images.caption: Pittenweem High Street. The view along the High Street to the Parish Church.

images.title: Jim Bain / Waggon Road, Pittenweem
images.caption: Waggon Road, Pittenweem. Old road from Coal Farm to Pittenweem harbour built for the transportation of coal from the pits around Coal and Waterless Farm area.

images.title: Richard Webb / St Fillan's Cave, Pittenweem
images.caption: St Fillan's Cave, Pittenweem. A former sea cave in sandstone, now lifted far above sea level by isostatic uplift. It is associated with several saints as well as St Fillan and still used for services on occasions.

images.title: Lis Burke / Billow Ness
images.caption: Billow Ness. This looks like the remains of another bathing pool similar to that at St Monans, with tiered seating to the left and a wall jutting out into the sea.

images.title: Richard Law / 'The Rockies' golf hole
images.caption: 'The Rockies' golf hole at Anstruther golf course. According to the sign, this hole on Anstruther golf course was voted "Britain's hardest par-3" in 2007, by Today's Golfer magazine. Maybe it's become easier since then, or they haven't voted yet this year? Either way, the green and hole are on the old raised beach (beyond the patch of gorse) whilst tee is on the top of the old cliffs, just out of shot on the right.

images.title: Richard Law / War memorial on the golf course
images.caption: War memorial on the golf course. The 'Twr' marked on the map at Billow Ness is actually a war memorial, right on the edge of the golf course.

images.title: Jim Bain / Sea Walls Wester Anstruther
images.caption: Sea Walls Wester Anstruther. I think these walls along the Wester Anstruther shore have a hint of the Mediterranean about them especially when the sun is shining unlike today.

description: This walk follows a lovely section of the Fife Coastal Path from Pittenweem to Anstruther. It's about a 2 mile walk along a fairly flat, waymarked footpath. The route starts in Pittenweem, a historic fishing village on the Fife coast. Highlights in the picturesque village include the artisan chocolatiers, 17th century buildings, fine shops, galleries and the ancient St Fillan's Cave. In the village you can pick up the waymarked coastal trail and follow it east past St Fillan's Cave to the Anstruther golf course and the striking coastline at Billow Ness. The route then passes along the attractive Anstruther Harbour before finishing in the town.
